Method Detail

fragmentLogProbability

public double fragmentLogProbability(SequenceFragment sequenceFragment,
                                     boolean perSample)
                              throws SequenceSpectrumException
Computes the total log probability of generating the given sequence fragment under the model. This differs from MarkovTreeNode.totalProbability(byte[]) in that the sequence fragment is not given explicitly but only as metadata. Thus its probability may be computed from summary statistics that are already available in the given SequenceFragment rather than from the raw sequence. Also, because these probabilities are typically very small, the result is returned in log space (indeed implementations will likely compute them in log space).

Note this computes the probability only in the forward direction (i.e., it does not take a reverse complement also).

Specified by:
fragmentLogProbability in interface SequenceSpectrum<MarkovTreeNode>
Overrides:
fragmentLogProbability in class MarkovTreeNode
Parameters:
sequenceFragment - the SequenceFragment whose probability is to be computed
perSample - normalize the probability by the number of samples found in the SequenceFragment, i.e., take the geometric mean
Returns:
the natural logarithm of the conditional probability (a double value between 0 and 1, inclusive)
Throws:
SequenceSpectrumException
